places.name: Heritage City Museum
places.description: Explore the rich history of our community through interactive exhibits and rare artifacts dating back to the early settlers. The museum features rotating exhibits and educational programs for all ages.

places.name: Riverside Park
places.description: A beautiful 50-acre park along the river featuring walking trails, picnic areas, and a playground. The park hosts concerts in the summer and has stunning views of the water and wildlife.

places.name: Artisan Marketplace
places.description: A vibrant indoor market featuring over 40 local artisans selling handcrafted goods, from jewelry to furniture. Visit on weekends for live demonstrations and workshops.

places.name: Historic Main Street
places.description: Stroll through our charming downtown with restored 19th-century buildings now housing boutique shops, cafes, and galleries. Don't miss the guided walking tours every Saturday morning.

places.name: Summit Lookout Point
places.description: Hike to this stunning viewpoint offering panoramic views of the entire valley. The moderate 2-mile trail is well-maintained and features educational signs about local geology and wildlife.

places.name: Oakwood Vineyards
places.description: Award-winning local winery offering tours and tastings of their signature varietals. Their seasonal farm-to-table restaurant uses ingredients grown on the property.

places.name: Tech Innovation Center
places.description: A hub for local entrepreneurs and tech startups featuring co-working spaces, educational workshops, and networking events. Public tours are available every Thursday.

places.name: Cultural Arts Center
places.description: Home to our community theater, art gallery, and music conservatory. Check their calendar for upcoming performances, exhibitions, and classes for all ages and skill levels.
